means: 施行暴政，实施集权统治，横行霸道

sentence.Network_en: He often misuses his authority to tyrannize his underlings.
sentence.Network_cn: 他常用手中的职权凌轹下属.

sentence.Network_en: Punish those who tyrannize over us and arrogantly mistreat us.
sentence.Network_cn: 求你惩罚那些欺压和傲慢侮辱我们的人!

sentence.Network_en: Her husband and mother - in - law tyrannize her.
sentence.Network_cn: 她丈夫和她 婆婆 虐待她.

list.abs: the oppressive government ; oppressive laws ; a tyrannical parent ; tyrannous disregard of human rights ., 暴虐的政府 ; 压迫人的法律 ; 暴虐的父亲 ; 暴虐 , 无视人权.
the people soon reacted against the tyrannical system ., 人们不久便起来反抗暴政.
He is a tyrannical person and often bashes his wife and children about ., 他是个残暴的人 , 经常殴打老婆孩子.

the first emperor , ShiHuang , was a tyrannical emperor who unified China by force and set about constructing one Great Wall-by joining , where possible , existing one and filling the gaps .第一个皇帝秦始皇，是一个暴君，他用武力统一了中国，并开始建造长城-用来连接可能的、现有的和填补缺口。
No one will like to live in a tyrannical despotism ., 谁也不愿意生活在一个暴君专制的国家.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from French tyranniser, from tyran 'tyrant'

entry.tran: 欺压;专横(或暴虐)地对待
entry.def: If you say that one person tyrannizes another, you mean that the first person uses their power over the second person in order to treat them very cruelly and unfairly.

example.ex: Armed groups use their power to tyrannise over civilians.
example.tran: 武装组织用武力欺压平民。

means.word_mean: 1. rule a country as a tyrant
2. rule or exercise power over (somebody) in a cruel and autocratic manner;

auth_sentence.content: Capricious, card-playing old women who tyrannize over...young men.
auth_sentence.res_content: Capricious, card-playing old women who tyrannize over...young men.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Capricious, card-playing old women who tyrannize over...young men.
